[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Security and Privacy Requirements Analysis Tool(SPRAT) defines requirements for a security and privacy analysis tool to enhance goal specification, traceability, and compliance verification.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SPRAT enables scenario mining, goal management, and policy alignment for security analysis.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SPRAT integrates with external repositories for structured policy retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SPRAT provides dashboards for administrators, analysts, and managers with role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SPRAT runs on database servers and secure storage for policy data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SPRAT supports APIs for policy management and third-party integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SPRAT ensures secure data exchange using encryption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SPRAT optimizes storage for policy and goal data retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SPRAT ensures availability with failover and real-time monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SPRAT is configurable for various security and privacy workflows.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SPRAT integrates with reporting and visualization tools.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SPRAT supports goal specification, scenario mining, and compliance tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: SPRAT is designed for analysts, project managers, auditors, and compliance officers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SPRAT depends on accurate security and privacy policy access.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SPRAT assumes integration with secure storage and policy repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Goal: A security or privacy objective that the system must achieve.
Scenario: A system behavior pattern describing actions in specific security and privacy contexts.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: SPRAT: Security and Privacy Requirements Analysis Tool
RACAF: Requirements-level Access Control Analysis Framework

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall retrieve policies from external repositories.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The platform shall provide APIs for third-party integration.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow goal classification and tracking (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall generate a requirements traceability matrix (REQ-DB-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive dashboard for user roles.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall support alerts and notifications (REQ-FUNC-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process policy queries within 2 seconds (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support 100 concurrent users (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store policies, goals, and traceability links securely.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The database shall maintain audit logs (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use a modular architecture for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall align with security and privacy regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall scale dynamically to handle growth.

[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, training guides, and API documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: SPRAT documentation, privacy and security policy standards.
